thread.title: Girls basketball: Ty Battle transfers to Oswego East
thread.title_full: Girls basketball: Ty Battle transfers to Oswego East - Chicago Tribune

author: Bob Narang
title: Girls basketball: Ty Battle transfers to Oswego East
text:
Former Joliet Catholic girls basketball coach Kenny Battle confirmed Thursday that his daughter Ty Battle has transferred to Oswego East.
Kenny Battle said he resigned from his position Tuesday afternoon for personal reasons. The former Illinois star coached the Angels to a 20-9 record and a Class 3A regional title in his lone season as head coach.
"Ty is going to a good school and she knows most of the kids on the team from having played with them in junior high," Kenny Battle said. "It was a good reception by the young ladies when they heard she was coming there. Ty is looking forward to going to Oswego East and moving on."
A 6-foot-1 junior forward, Ty Battle averaged 11.9 points and 7.8 rebounds for the Angels last season. As a freshman in 2013-14, she was a starter on the Angels' Class 3A runner-up squad.
Oswego East coach Abe Carretto said he's familiar with Ty Battle's game.
"This summer I got a chance to really watch her play in a shootout we were in," Carretto said. "I also watched her play during her freshman year, when she went downstate, and in middle school. I've seen enough to see that she's a very good player.
"I think she's very athletic and has a good knack for the where the ball is going to be. From what I've seen, she does the right things to help her team."
The Wolves return three starters from last season's 17-12 squad, including Southwest Prairie All-Conference frontcourt players Sydney Schultz and Jada Boatright.
Girls hoops: Joliet Catholic coach Kenny Battle steps down Bob Narang Former NBA and Illinois forward Kenny Battle resigned from his position as Joliet Catholic's girls basketball coach Tuesday afternoon for personal reasons.
Battle informed his players about his decision to step down during a team meeting Tuesday. In his lone season at Joliet Catholic, Battle guided...
Former NBA and Illinois forward Kenny Battle resigned from his position as Joliet Catholic's girls basketball coach Tuesday afternoon for personal reasons.
Battle informed his players about his decision to step down during a team meeting Tuesday. In his lone season at Joliet Catholic, Battle guided...
(Bob Narang) "Ty has been playing with Sydney since fourth grade, playing on the same travel team and AAU and junior high team," Kenny Battle said. "They know each other well."
Carretto said Ty Battle should fit in perfectly on a talented team.
"I was excited anyway because we had a pretty good summer," Carretto said, "and all of sudden, in the last 36 hours, this came about. I haven't told all the girls. I wasn't expecting this. I'm going to start talking to some of the players and figure out how we can make sure when Ty comes to school that she feels comfortable."
Narang is a freelance reporter for Chicago Tribune.
